response.raw:
Here is my suggested output:

Instructing Students Individually and in Groups

1. Prepare engaging lesson plans - Develop lectures, discussions, demonstrations and other teaching methods to convey the material - Incorporate different learning styles (visual, auditory, kinesthetic) to reach all students 2. Deliver instruction to the full class - Present lectures and lead class discussions - Use visual aids, multimedia, and demonstrations as appropriate - Ask questions to check for understanding and encourage participation 3. Break class into small groups - Assign group projects and activities - Have students collaborate and learn from each other - Circulate between groups to facilitate discussion and answer questions 4. Work with students one-on-one - Provide individualized instruction as needed - Help students who are struggling with the material - Offer enrichment to students who need an extra challenge 5. Assess learning and adjust instruction - Evaluate students' understanding through assignments, quizzes, projects - Identify areas where students need additional support - Modify lessons and teaching methods as needed to optimize learning
